info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berkshire County through 900 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Otis, or 10 miles east of Great Barrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Becket, Otis, Tyringham, Becket Center, Otis Wood Lanes, West Becket, Algerie Four Corners, Bonny Rigg Corners, North Otis and West Otis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
